name: Relief for Energy Assistance through Community Help (REACH)
description: Up to $300 energy credit for past-due bills if received 15-day or 48-hour disconnection notice for income-eligible customers; can apply once per 12 months
fullDescription: The REACH program provides emergency bill assistance for PG&E customers facing disconnection, offering up to $300 to help income-eligible households avoid losing power or gas service.
whatTheyOffer:
- Up to $300 energy bill credit
- Helps prevent service disconnection
- For customers who received shutoff notice
- Available once every 12 months
- Payment goes directly to PG&E bill
- Can combine with other assistance programs
howToGetIt:
1. Must be income-eligible (up to 200% federal poverty level)
2. Must have received 15-day or 48-hour disconnection notice
3. Apply online or call REACH hotline
4. Provide proof of income if requested
5. Credit applied directly to your PG&E account
6. Can reapply after 12 months if needed
